citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee has a new part-time attending veterinarian but has not updated the written program of veterinary care to
reflect this change. The only written program of veterinary care has the old attending veterinarian who has stopped seeing
wildlife. The facility has a new attending veterinarian who has already performed a site visit but the paperwork has not
been updated to reflect the new attending veterinarian.
It is important to maintain a formal, written arrangement with a program of veterinary care for all part-time attending
veterinarians so that the facility has directions for how to handle potential medical concerns with their animals.
Correct by June 23, 2023 by ensuring a formal arrangement between a facility and a part-time veterinarian is documented
with a written program of veterinarian care and includes regularly scheduled visits to the premises.

The facility does not have a comprehensive written contingency plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment,
transportation, housing, or care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
If an emergency or natural disaster were to occur at the facility, the lack of a complete written contingency plan could
impact animal health if staff are not prepared to respond to the situation appropriately.
Correct by June 23, 2023 by developing, documenting, and following an appropriate contingency plan to provide for the
humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the the event of an emergency or
disaster.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
